name: Sibiu
fun_fact: Fun fact: Sibiu was named European Region of Gastronomy in 2019 and is a delightful blend of Romanian, Hungarian, and German (Saxon) influences. This medieval Transylvanian fortress city has transformed into a dynamic food destination while preserving traditional recipes passed down through generations in a region famous for Dracula legends.

hero_dishes.name: Sarmale (Cabbage Rolls)

hero_dishes.name: CiorbÄƒ de BurtÄƒ (Tripe Soup)
hero_dishes.description: A beloved Romanian staple - creamy, sour tripe soup with rich flavor, served with vinegar and hot peppers. The sour tang comes from fermented wheat bran or vinegar.
hero_dishes.origin_story: This soup represents Romania's resourceful peasant cuisine, using every part of the animal. It's considered a hangover cure and comfort food, deeply embedded in Romanian food culture.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Traditional 'hanuri' (inns) and 'crame' (wine cellars) throughout Sibiu's old town

food_culture_notes: Sibiu's cuisine reflects its Saxon (German) stronghold history - robust, flavorful dishes with locally sourced ingredients

Dining in historical buildings ('hanuri' inns, 'crame' wine cellars) offers immersive atmosphere
